etymology.description: semantic: 宀 ‘roof’ + phonetic: 𢑓 (xiá, ‘male pig’); later misread/replaced by 豕.
etymology.interpretation: Meaning centers on a dwelling, while the embedded 𢑓 provided the sound in Old Chinese rather than literal meaning. Later graphic change to 豕 led to the folk idea of “pig under a roof,” but the original phonetic was a different pig-related graph.

examples.chinese: 我回家吃饭(我回家吃飯)。
这个家很温暖(這個家很溫暖)。
他是著名的画家(他是著名的畫家)。
